DealerOn Academy

Float

Just add water.
Float Property
The float property specifies whether or not a box element should float.

w3Schools

Block formatting context.

Remember
  1. Floated blocks display as inline-blocks
  2. The parent of a floated element requires special treatment*
    or…the next element in document flow must be cleared.
  3. Floats and widths are friends, along with box-sizing…*
  4. Inline elements can float.

* see below

None

.float--none {
float:none;
}

I'm not floating.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Libero molestiae quasi placeat! Esse pariatur ea, atque velit repellat vel hic, molestias laudantium quasi, error qui sed!

Left

.float--left {
float:left;
}

I'm floating left.

We're floating left.

Right

.float--right {
float:right;
}

I'm floating right.

Both

.float--left {
float:left;
}
.float--right {
float:right;
}

I'm floating left.
I'm floating right.

Simple Grid

.float--left {
float:left;
width:50%;
box-sizing:border-box;
}

I'm floating left.
I'm floating left.

.float--left {
float:left;
width:25%;
box-sizing:border-box;
}

I'm floating left.
I'm floating left.
I'm floating left.
I'm floating left.
Parent Cleared

Telling the div to hide overflowing elements is one of many techniques used to keep the parent of a floated element in document flow. Or you can use the clear property on the next element.

Check out other techniques here or simply Google "techniques for clearing floats".

.float--cleared {
overflow:hidden;
}

I'm floating left.
I'm floating right.

Parent Not Cleared

Notice how the parent element is collapsed.

I'm floating left.
I'm floating right.

Next element cleared

p {
clear:both;
}

I'm floating left.
